Democrats voted against @RepRiggleman's amendment to take up the bipartisan @PatrickMcHenry & @RepMaxineWaters' #ExIm reauthorization agreement to take meaningful action against #China’s human rights abuses, military aggression, & plan to dominate the global economy. (6/6)
Democrats opposed @WarrenDavidson's amendment to deny #ExIm assistance to a government the President determines isn’t cooperating with us to stop the flood of #opioids into our country. (5/6)

Democrats voted down @RepAGonzalez's amendment to the partisan #ExIm reauthorization bill to ensure Chinese bullying of American companies does not lead to infringements on Americans’ right to #freespeech. (4/6)
Democrats opposed @RepTipton's amendment to prohibit #ExIm assistance for Chinese state-owned companies that advance China’s Belt & Road Initiative. (3/6)
Democrats voted down an amendment to #ExIm reauthorization, offered by @RepHuizenga, to protect U.S. #elections from Russian interference. (2/6)
#ExIm debate ➡️ @FSCDems just voted against: @PatrickMcHenry’s bipartisan solution to reauthorize the #ExIm Bank & combat the generational threat posed by #China. (1/6)

.@RepAndyBarr: The Financial Services Committee has an opportunity to stand with #HongKong by adopting this amendment. #ExIm has no place subsidizing the Chinese government while it’s cracking down on demonstrators in Hong Kong. pic.twitter.com/msDWFpD0TV

Chinese bullying of American companies' policies, most recently the @NBA’s, is a real threat. @RepAGonzalez offered an amendment to Democrats' #ExIm reauthorization bill to ensure this bullying does not lead to infringements on Americans' right to #freespeech. pic.twitter.com/C8GbuV1EHv

#OpioidEpidemic ➡️ FSC Democrats are opposing an amendment offered by @WarrenDavidson to deny #ExIm Bank assistance to a government, and the entities it controls, if the President determines that government isn’t cooperating with us to stop the flood of opioids into our country.

At today's #ExIm markup, @RepHuizenga asked Democrats a simple question: if a state-owned company is involved in China's abuse of human rights, debt-trap diplomacy, or militarization of the South #China Sea, why should ExIm subsidize that same company? pic.twitter.com/wKRQWTuKMM

Rep Heck (D-WA): "Let's please set aside this idea that there are American #taxpayer dollars involved in the #ExIm Bank."

#FactCheck: By law, ExIm’s guarantees are backed by the full faith & credit of the U.S. government - that means U.S. #taxpayers
